Title: Reinforcing youth reading habits through text-based games
Source title: Proceedings of the 2015 4th International Conference on Interactive Digital Media, ICIDM 2015
Affiliations: Binus University, Indonesia; Statistics Department, Padjadjaran University, Bandung, Indonesia; Kummara Studio, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Harianto, A., Binus University, Indonesia; Nugroho, E., Statistics Department, Padjadjaran University, Bandung, Indonesia; Fredericco, R., Kummara Studio, Indonesia
Abstract: A text-based game is a type of video games that primarily uses writing and text characters to engage players with minimal to no graphics. With the availability of smartphones and tablets, text-based games have been seeing a resurgence in popularity. At the same time, most youths nowadays prefer using their smartphones rather than reading books. In this paper we will discuss the possibility of using text-based games to motivate and/or develop a reading habit for youths. © 2015 IEEE.
